title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) — In the annals of the NBA, there are performances that defy comprehension, nights where one man simply wills his team to victory. Thursday evening in San Antonio was one of those nights.

The story was not the final score, a 97-93 victory for the Spurs over the Orlando Magic. The story was David Robinson. The Admiral did not just play basketball; he orchestrated a one-man symphony of dominance, pouring in a superhuman 47 points while grabbing 15 rebounds. From the opening tip, it was clear he was operating on a different plane, a force of nature the Magic had no answer for.

Orlando, led by a gritty 24 points from Rony Seikaly and 20 from the inimitable Penny Hardaway, fought valiantly. They traded blows, matching the Spurs’ intensity for long stretches. But every time the Magic threatened to seize momentum, Robinson was there—a silky turnaround jumper, a powerful drive through the lane, an authoritative put-back. His 47 points were not just a number; they were a relentless, crushing weight.

The Spurs needed every single one of them. Timely contributions from Vinny Del Negro (16 points) and Sean Elliott (15 points) provided just enough support, but this was Robinson’s masterpiece. In a tight, physical contest where every possession mattered, he was the unstoppable constant.

When the final horn sounded, the scoreboard told a simple story of a four-point Spurs win. But those in the arena, and those who would later see the stat sheet, knew they had witnessed something far grander: a historic individual performance from David Robinson, a legendary effort that lifted his team and left an indelible mark on the season.
